Posts.Content: Hi all! Some advice appreciated. I was diagnosed in July'17 with prostate cancer that had also spread to my lymph nodes. Initial PSA was 748ug/l with a gleason score of 10. I'm 47 years old. First ADT injection in August'17 followed by chemo (6 cycles of Docetaxel). Had RP with pelvic & para aortic nodal dissection in March'18. 61 lymph nodes removed with 26 of them positive (YpT3bN1M1a). Completed 7 weeks of radiation 2 weeks ago. Current PSA less than 0.1ug/l. Feeling good, tired in the evenings. My question is, what can I expect? Oncologists are not very talkative! I'm positive but also realistic. Any thoughts & experiences would be very much appreciated ��. Thank You! BiographyEdit Value 25/07/17 Pain and numbness into right foot / Lower back discomfort / Leg weakness. CT Chest Abdo W Cont : Prostate gland enlarged & irregular. Prostatic malignancy with extracapsular spread of tumour with extensive retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy ext up to aorto caval region. Pelvic confluent lymph node mass measuring 8cn x 5cm. No sclerotic or destructive bone lesions identified. PSA 748Ng/ml 27/07/17 Prostate MRI : Extensive primary prostatic malignancy with widespread localised lymphadenopathy & local extension outside the gland. Large right sided lymphadenopathy with a conglomerate nodal mass (7.8cm x 4.2cm) left external iliac node but a right common iliac paraortic nodes measuring up to 1.5cm. Right leg issues as a result or nerve root compression. 04/08/17 Casodex 50mg for 6 weeks 23/08/17 Prostate Biopsy / Gleason 5+5=10 / PSA 829Ng/ml 25/08/2017 Started 3 monthly Decapeptyl injections 11/09/2017 PSA 98.8 Ng/ml 14/09/2017 Commenced Chemotherapy (Docetaxol 75mg per m/sq , 21 days with prednisone 5mgs daily x 6 cycles) 14/03/2018 Travelled to University Hospital Leuven, Belgium for radical retropubical prostatectomy with extended lymphadenectomy (61 Lymph nodes removed with 29 positive. Catheter also inserted. 23/03/2018 Travelled back home to Ireland! 26/03/2018 Staples removed. All good! 18/04/2018 Catheder removed. 26/09/2018 Radiotherapy to prostate bed & nodes (x 35 fractions) 31/10/2018 Finished radiotherapy! YpT3bN1M1a Current PSA <0.1Ng/ml Current Medication : Palexia (50mg twice daily) Rivotril (500 mcg tablets once daily) Zopitan (7.5mg at night) Other than all of the above, I'm feeling great. ED & a slight leakage but hey, that's what pads are for! Looking forwards now, not backwards.
Posts.Title: Advice Appreciated!
